hours_text:
Explore the fascinating and turbulent story of water, people and the Catskills, which began thousands of years ago, and continues today.   
  
**Open**  
12pm to 4pm   
Saturday’s and Sunday’s (through the end of September 2025).  
_Open other times by appointment (845) 985-7700_  
  
**Adults** : $10  
**Children** (6 to 17): $5  
**Under 6** : FREE  
  
(845) 985-7700  
332 Main Street Grahamsville, NY 12740  

### [Current  
Exhibits](https://www.timeandthevalleysmuseum.org/exhibits/)

### [Lost Catskill   
Farm](https://www.timeandthevalleysmuseum.org/lost-catskill-farm/)

### [Driving  
Tours](https://www.timeandthevalleysmuseum.org/driving-tours/)

### [Adult  
Tours](https://www.timeandthevalleysmuseum.org/adult-tours/)

collections_text:
## Time and the Valleys Museum

_**Connecting Water, People, and the Catskills**_  
Exploring NYC’s Water Systems and the sacrifices made by local residents   
to provide New York City with clean water.  

# Our Vision

The Catskills’ leading resource for exploring the history and future of access to clean water.

[](https://i0.wp.com/www.timeandthevalleysmuseum.org/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Wave-5.png?ssl=1)

## What our visitors have to say:  

“Visiting the TATV Museum is a precious learning experience. Much appreciation for all the effort for preserving histories and reconnecting people with the water resources   
of this area.”  
2023

“What a treasure. Thank you!”  
-Ron and Sally T., 2023   
  
“It is a tribute to the people of this area that this wonderful exhibit is able to be viewed.”  
2023

“What a great exhibit! Especially like all the historical info and the painted interpretations,   
and especially the   
Taggart art works!”  
-Anne and George S., 2023

     Verified 
    
    **A lovely look back in the Past of the Lower Catskills**
    A very well laid out history of the Catskills and the mountains around the museum..Wonderful photos and stories..Well worth the drive to Grahamsville,in fact the wonderful "secret" of the village.

     Posted on   

     Shamus Fla 

     Verified 
    
    **A great way to learn local history!**
    I really enjoyed this museum! It told a lot about the history of the region, about water, and about the history of water getti...
